results.title: A John Wick Action Scene, Step by Step
results.abstract: Look behind the scenes at the climactic sequence in “John Wick: Chapter 4,” set on 222 steps leading up to the Sacré-Coeur Basilica in Paris.

results.title: ‘Spin Me Round,’ ‘Small Town Crime’ and More Streaming Gems
results.abstract: This month’s recommended viewing includes a pair of unconventional rom-coms, genre titles with a lot on their minds and two must-see docs for music lovers.

results.title: Ari Aster Has Something Funny to Show You. Don’t Be Scared.
results.abstract: The maker of “Midsommar” may be known for horror, but he thought that film was comical. With his latest movie, “Beau Is Afraid,” the dark humor is more apparent.

multimedia.caption: Ari Aster initially intended “Beau Is Afraid” to be his first film. Instead he spent time during the pandemic lockdown honing the script into an uncompromising follow-up to “Midsommar.”
multimedia.copyright: Victor Llorente for The New York Times

multimedia.caption: Ari Aster initially intended “Beau Is Afraid” to be his first film. Instead he spent time during the pandemic lockdown honing the script into an uncompromising follow-up to “Midsommar.”

results.title: Disney Lays Off Ike Perlmutter, Chairman of Marvel Entertainment
results.abstract: The move, part of a cost-cutting campaign, followed Mr. Perlmutter’s unsuccessful effort to shake up Disney’s board.

results.title: Little Lionsgate Soars to the Top With John Wick Ticket Sales
results.abstract: “John Wick: Chapter 4” took in roughly $73.5 million on its opening weekend, a rare phenomenon this far into a series.

results.abstract: In the latest and longest movie set in Wick World, Keanu Reeves’s titular assassin visits Paris and paints the town red.

results.title: With Films Like ‘Inside,’ One Actor Does the Heavy Lifting
results.abstract: Filmmakers behind movies that place one character in one location discuss the challenges this type of project brings.

results.title: ‘In Viaggio: The Travels of Pope Francis’ Review: Serene Demeanor, Bracing Message
results.abstract: The Pontiff travels well. Gianfranco Rosi’s new documentary chronicles his visits to Catholic communities the world over, and he never seems to tire.
des_facet: In Viaggio: The Travels of Pope Francis (Movie)

multimedia.caption: In his first nine years as Pope, Francis visited almost 60 countries. Gianfranco Rosi’s documentary features footage shot over those years.
In his first nine years as Pope, Francis visited almost 60 countries. Gianfranco Rosi’s documentary features footage shot over those years.
In his first nine years as Pope, Francis visited almost 60 countries. Gianfranco Rosi’s documentary features footage shot over those years.

results.abstract: An assassin must choose between the murderous career she loves and the daughter she’s been hiding it from.

results.title: Teyana Taylor Has a Story to Tell
results.abstract: After stepping away from recording music, the artist has turned to movies with a lead role in “A Thousand and One.”

results.title: Prosecutor Behind ‘Rust’ Charges Steps Aside, Appointing Replacements
results.abstract: The involuntary manslaughter case against Alec Baldwin has suffered setbacks, and now the district attorney has withdrawn from the case and named two special prosecutors.

multimedia.caption: Mary Carmack-Altwies, the district attorney of Santa Fe County in New Mexico, named two special prosecutors to handle the “Rust” case.

results.title: At New Directors/New Films, See the World Through Perceptive Filmmakers’ Eyes
results.abstract: “Earth Mama,” “Tótem” and other strong entries offer proof that the art form is flourishing regardless of what’s happening in Hollywood.

results.title: ‘Petite Solange’ Review: Coming of Age as Your Parents Divorce
results.abstract: Axelle Ropert’s carefully calibrated film from France follows a girl experiencing the pain of having to accept her parents as people with faults.

results.title: ‘Reggie’ Review: Reggie Jackson on Himself, Racism and, Yes, Baseball
results.abstract: Jackson, a.k.a. Mr. October, was called a lot of things during his storied career with the Yankees. A new documentary goes beyond the nicknames.

multimedia.caption: In 1977, Reggie Jackson hit three home runs in a single World Series game. He was a star on the field, and now he’s a star in the documentary “Reggie.”
In 1977, Reggie Jackson hit three home runs in a single World Series game. He was a star on the field, and now he’s a star in the documentary “Reggie.”

results.title: ‘Ithaka’ Review: In Julian Assange They Trust
results.abstract: A frustrating new advocacy documentary about the WikiLeaks founder, with appearances by his father and wife, loses its footing on weak assertions and reporting.

multimedia.caption: Julian Assange’s father, John Shipton, becomes his son’s onscreen avatar in “Ithaka.”

results.title: ‘A Good Person’ Review: Zach Braff’s New Chapter
results.abstract: The filmmaker behind “Garden State” has created a fully drawn female character in Florence Pugh’s grieving addict. But this recovery drama often has too heavy a hand.

results.title: ‘Nam June Paik: Moon Is the Oldest TV’ Review: Art Onscreen

results.title: John Wick Sure Has a Lot of Friends for a Lone Assassin
results.abstract: How does a taciturn solo killer have so many pals? The films’ creators can’t really explain, but each character has a raison d’être in this world.

multimedia.caption: John Wick (Keanu Reeves), center, and his pals the Bowery King (Laurence Fishburne), left, and Winston (Ian McShane) in installment No. 4.
